title: Isolation of Human Endometrial Stromal Cells for In Vitro Decidualization
procedures:
All human endometrium biopsies collected for this study were attained from the Washington University in St. Louis, Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology using an Institutional Review Board (IRB) approved written consent form.
1. Preparation
Prepare 500 mL of 1x Hank's Balanced Salt Solution (HBSS) by adding 100 U/mL penicillin and 100 µg/mL streptomycin to the media containing bottle (further referenced as HBSS+ medium).
Prepare 500 mL of Dulbecco's Modified Eagle Medium: Nutrient Mixture F-12 (DMEM/F12) with phenol red, L-glutamine, and 15 mM 4-(2-hydroxyethyl)-1-piperazineethanesulfonic acid (HEPES) by adding 1% antibiotic-antimycotic solution (the final concentration is 100 U/mL Penicillin, 100 µg/mL Streptomycin, and 0.25 µg/mL Fungizone) to the media containing bottle (Further referenced as HESC Isolation Media).
Prepare 500 mL of DMEM/F12 with phenol red, L-glutamine, and 15 mM HEPES by adding 10% Fetal Bovine Serum (FBS), 1x Na2HCO3, and 1% Penicillin (10,000 U/mL) and Streptomycin (10,000 µg/mL) (Pen Strep) to the media containing bottle (Further referenced as HESC Media).
Prepare 500 mL of Reduced Serum Medium with L-Glutamine, 2.4 g/L sodium bicarbonate, and HEPES with 2% Charcoal Stripped Fetal Bovine Serum (csFBS) and 1% Pen Strep to the media containing bottle (Further referenced as Decidualization Media).
Prepare 500 mL of Phenol red free DMEM/F12 by adding 2% charcoal stripped fetal bovine serum (csFBS) in the media containing bottle (Further referenced as Change Media).
Prepare 10 nM estradiol (E2), 1 µM medroxyprogesterone acetate (MPA), and 50 µM cyclic adenosine monophosphate (cAMP) in a 15 mL polypropylene conical tube, and add to a 2 mL per well aliquot of previously prepared decidualization media for in vitro decidualization assay (Further referenced as EPC Media).
Prepare 50 mL of freezing media with 90% FBS and 10% Dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO) in 50 mL polypropylene conical tube (Further referenced as Freezing Media).

Pre-weigh 25 mg of Collagenase and 5 mg of DNase I in a 50 mL conical polypropylene tube and store at -20°C.
2. Human Endometrium Biopsy Acquisition
Obtain human endometrium biopsy samples collected in the proliferative phase (Day 9 - Day 12) of the menstrual cycle from the IRB approved clinic in HBSS.
Wash biopsy samples with 1 mL of prewarmed 37 °C HBSS+ medium and gently shake to remove excess blood and mucous.
3. Isolation of Human Endometrial Stromal Cells (HESC)
Note: This isolation procedure is performed in a sterile environment under a biological safety cabinet.
Transfer the biopsy with sterilized forceps into a 50 mL conical polypropylene centrifuge tube containing 10 mL fresh HBSS.
Centrifuge the biopsy at room temperature at 500 x g for 90 s.
	
If the cell pellet ruptures, re-spin the biopsy at 2,000 x g for 90 s.
Remove the media using a 1 mL pipet and wash with 10 mL of 37 °C prewarmed HESC Isolation Media followed by centrifugation at 500 x g for 90 s.
Remove the media using a 1 mL pipet, and vigorously add 3 mL of fresh HESC Isolation Media to dislodge the biopsy.
Decant the biopsy into a Petri dish containing 5 mL of HESC Isolation Media.
Mince the biopsy into as small pieces as possible using #5 forceps and fine straight stitch scissors for about 20 minutes.
Prepare DNase I and Collagenase enzymes by adding 10 mL of HESC Isolation Media to pre-weighed DNase I (0.5 mg/mL) and Collagenase (2.5 mg/mL). Mix with pipet.
Pipette cut tissue samples using a 1 mL pipet into a new 50 mL conical polypropylene tube. Wash with 7 mL of HESC Isolation Media and add to the polypropylene tube to acquire the full sample.

Centrifuge the sample at room temperature at 800 x g for 2 min. Gently remove the supernatant by pipette.
Filter the DNase I and Collagenase solution through 0.2 µm filter attached to 10 mL syringe directly onto pellet.
Vortex for 10 s to resuspend pellet.
Digest in 37 °C water bath for 1.5 h, vortexing for 10 s thoroughly every 10 min, until tissue is digested.
Filter the sample through a 40 µm cell strainer stacked over a 50 mL conical polypropylene tube to remove the epithelial cells and tissue debris.
	NOTE: Stromal cells are in the 50 mL conical polypropylene tube.
Centrifuge the 50 mL conical polypropylene tube at 800 x g for 2.5 min at room temperature. Gently remove the supernatant with a 1 mL pipette.
Resuspend the pellet in 10 mL of HESC Isolation Media.
Centrifuge at 800 x g for 2.5 min at room temperature. Aspirate the supernatant, and then resuspend cells in 6 mL of HESC Media and pipette forward and reverse to mix.
Slowly layer on 3 mL of density gradient media to the resuspended cells to separate out remaining blood cells from the stromal cells, being careful not to mix the layers.
Centrifuge the 15 mL polypropylene tube at 400 x g for 30 min at room temperature.
Collect 5 mL of the supernatant in a new 50 mL polypropylene tube and add an additional 5 mL HESC Media to resuspend the cells.
Centrifuge at 800 x g for 2.5 min at room temperature, followed by removal of the supernatant and addition of 6 mL HESC Media. Vortex the sample for 10 s and mix by pipetting forward and reverse 5 times.
Aliquot 10 µL of re-suspended cells to a 1.5 mL microcentrifuge tube for cell count.

Add 10 µL of 0.4% Trypan Blue stain to cell aliquot and mix with pipet. Load 10 µL of the aliquot and count the cells using a hemocytometer.
Plate the cells in an appropriate flask dependent on total cell count in 15 mL HESC Media.
	
If the total number of cells is less than 1 million, plate all cells in 25-cm flask with 6 mL of HESC Media. If the total number of cells is more than 1 million, plate all cells in 75-cm flask with 15 mL of HESC Media.
Culture the cells in a 5% CO2 incubator at 37 °C for a minimum of 6 h to ensure proper cell adhesion and change the media to HESC Media.
Culture the isolated HESC in a 5% CO2 incubator at 37 °C for a period of 3-5 days until the cells form a monolayer achieving 80 - 90% confluency in a plated flask.
Change HESC Media every two days.
	
Warm HESC Media in a 37 °C water bath for 15-20 min.
Aspirate media from the flask and add fresh HESC Media to the flask (working volume: 8 mL or 16 mL per 25-cm or 75-cm flask respectively).
Place flask back into the 5% CO2 incubator at 37 °C until 80-90% confluency is achieved.
Once HESC become 80 - 90% confluent, transfer cells from 25-cm to 75-cm flask or from one 75-cm flask to three 75-cm flasks.
	NOTE: HESC can be frozen and stored for later usage at this time for future experimentation.
4. Freezing and Thawing HESCs
Aspirate media from the 75-cm flask and add 2 mL of trypsin-EDTA.
Incubate in a 5% CO2 incubator for 2-3 min at 37 °C until the cells dislodge from the flask.

Add 7 mL of HESC Media and mix well by pipetting forward and reverse.
Centrifuge at 800 x g for 2.5 min and aspirate the supernatant.
Label freezing tubes with cell line, date, and passage number.
Re-suspend the cell pellet in 5 mL of freezing media.
Aliquot 1 mL of the re-suspended HESC to each tube and transfer tubes to -80 °C freezer.
Transfer tubes to liquid nitrogen within 24 hours.
	NOTE: If planning to thaw cells in immediate future, store frozen cells in -80 °C for one month.
For thawing the HESCs preheat HESC Media for 20 min.
Add 8 mL of preheated HESC Media to 25-cm flask.
Retrieve the freezing tube from the liquid nitrogen tank or -80 °C and submerge the tube in 37 °C water bath for 1-2 min to thaw the cells.
Transfer thawed HESC to a 25-cm flask with HESC Media and incubate in a 5% CO2 incubator overnight at 37 °C.
Next day, change the HESC Media and wait for 2-3 days until HESC become confluent and transfer cells to 75-cm flask as detailed below in Protocol 5.
	
Warm HESC Media in a 37 °C water bath for 15-20 min.
Aspirate media from the flask and add fresh HESC Media to the flask (working volume: 8 mL or 16 mL per 25-cm or 75-cm flask respectively).
Place flask back into the 5% CO2 incubator at 37 °C until 80-90% confluency is achieved.
5. Human Endometrial Stromal Cell (HESC) Culturing
Note: This Culturing procedure is performed in a sterile environment under a biological safety cabinet.
Pre-heat HESC Media at 37°C in a water bath for 20-30 min.
Aspirate media from the flask and add 0.25% Trypsin ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid (EDTA) (1 mL for 25-cm flask or 2 mL for 75-cm flask).

Incubate in a 5% CO2 incubator at 37 °C for 2-3 min until the cells dislodge.
Gently tap the flask walls to dislodge the remaining cells. Add 7 mL of HESC Media and mix well by pipetting forward and reverse.
Pipet the cell mixture into a 50 mL conical polypropylene tube and centrifuge at 800 x g for 2.5 min at room temperature.
Aspirate the supernatant and re-suspend the cell pellet in HESC Media.
	
Add 15 mL for 25-cm flask or 45mL for 75-cm flask (15 mL each).
Add 5 mL or 15 mL cell suspension to each 25-cm or 75-cm flask respectively.
Culture the isolated HESC in a 5% CO2 incubator at 37 °C for a period of 3-5 days until the cells form a monolayer achieving 80 - 90% confluency in a plated flask.
Change HESC Media every two days.
	
Warm HESC Media in a 37 °C water bath for 15-20 min.
Aspirate media from the flask and add fresh HESC Media to the flask (working volume: 8 mL or 16 mL per 25-cm or 75-cm flask respectively).
Place flask back into the 5% CO2 incubator at 37 °C until 80-90% confluency is achieved.
6. Human Endometrial Stromal Cell (HESC) Plating and siRNA Transfection
Note: This transfection procedure is performed in a sterile environment under a biological safety cabinet.
Aspirate HESC Media from the 75-cm flask and add 2 mL of 0.25% trypsin-EDTA solution.
Incubate in 5% CO2 incubator at 37 °C for 2-3 min until the cells dislodge.
Once cells are dislodged from the flask, add 7 mL of HESC Media and mix gently by pipetting forward and reverse 5 times.

Pipet the cell mixture into a 50 mL conical polypropylene tube and centrifuge at 800 x g for 2.5 min at room temperature. Aspirate the supernatant and re-suspend the cell pellet in 10 mL of HESC Media.
	NOTE: If plating cells from more than one flask, simply increase the HESC Media volume.
Count cells using a Hemocytometer.
	
Aliquot 10 µL of re-suspended cells into a 1.5 mL microcentrifuge tube.
Add 10 µL of 0.4% Trypan Blue stain to cell aliquot and mix by pipetting forward and reverse.
Plate 0.8 x 105 cells per well in 6-well plates. After two days, cells should be 60-70% confluent for optimal transfection.
For each siRNA transfection sample, prepare complexes using siRNA (60 nanomoles) to transfection reagent.
Dilute 5 µL of transfection reagent in 150 µL of reduced serum free media and incubate for 5 min.
Dilute 60 nanomoles of siRNA in 100 µL of reduced serum free media and incubate for 5 min.
After 5 minutes, combine diluted siRNA with diluted transfection reagent solution and mix gently by pipetting forward and reverse 5 times.
	NOTE: If transfecting one or more siRNA in multiple wells, prepare master mix in 10 mL polystyrene tubes.
Incubate siRNA-transfection reagent complexes for 5 min at room temperature.
During this incubation, add 1 mL of Change Media to each well.
After 5 min of incubation, centrifuge tubes at 500 x g for 2 min to collect solution and add the 250 µL of siRNA-transfection reagent complexes to each well containing cells and media.
Mix by gently rocking and incubate the cells at 37°C in a 5% CO2 incubator for 5 h.
After 5 h, change the media to HESC Media.

Incubate the cells at 37 °C in a 5% CO2 incubator for 2 days in preparation for an in vitro decidualization assay.
7. In Vitro Decidualization Assay
Note: This assay is performed in a sterile environment under a biological safety cabinet.
Prepare the EPC media prior to initiating the in vitro decidualization treatment as described in Camden et al.3 (See 1.6).
Aspirate the media from the post-48 hour transfected line of HESC incubated from step 6.16.
Add 2 mL of EPC Media into each well.
	Note: As a control, leave one set of cells untreated with EPC Media. Instead, add 2 mL of HESC Media to the control wells.
Incubate the cells in 5% CO2 incubator at 37 °C for 6 days.
	
Change the EPC Media every 48 hours.
		
Warm and prepare EPC Media in a 37 °C water bath for 15-20 min.
Aspirate media from the well and add fresh EPC Media.
Place the plate back into the 5% CO2 incubator at 37 °C.
After the sixth day, analyze the extent of stromal cell decidualization via ELISA and qRT-PCR (as described below).
8. Validation of In Vitro Decidualization utilizing Quantitative Real Time PCR (qRT-PCR)
Note: qRT-PCR is completed as previously described in Kommagani et al10.
Isolate the total RNA from HESC utilizing the protocol from a commercially available RNA isolation kit.
	
Analyze the RNA quantity and purity (A260/A280) using a NanoDrop or similar methodology as described in Garcia-Elias et al15.
Synthesize cDNA from 1 µg of total RNA through a commercially available reverse transcription kit protocol.
Run a qRT-PCR reaction as described in a commercially available qRT-PCR kit protocol.
	
Perform the reaction using a commercially available Real-Time PCR Master Mix and gene specific probes along with internal system controls (18s, PRL, and IGFBP1).

9. Validation of In Vitro  Decidualization utilizing ELISA
Quantify the secreted Prolactin levels from the tissue culture media utilizing a commercially available Prolactin ELISA kit.
10. Validation of In Vitro Decidualization utilizing Phalloidin staining.
Insert sterile coverslips into each well of a 12 well plate.
Repeat steps 6.1 - 6.5.
Plate 0.8 x 105 cells per well of a 12 well plate.
Incubate the cells in 5% CO2 incubator at 37 °C for 2 days.
Aspirate the media.
Repeat steps 7.3 - 7.4.
Fix the cells in 4% paraformaldehyde (PFA) in phosphate buffered saline (PBS) at room temperature for 30 min.
Aspirate the fixation solution and wash 3 times with 1 mL of PBS for 5 min each.
Add 0.1% non-ionic surfactant Polyethylene glycol tert-octyl phenyl ether in PBS for 5 min to the fixed cells to increase permeability.
Wash 3 times with 1 mL of PBS for 5 min each.
Add 100 µL of phalloidin solution per coverslip and incubate at room temperature for 90 min.
	
Prepare 1:100 dilution in PBS from using a phalloidin stock solution in 1 unit per 5 µL.
Wash 3 times with 1 mL of PBS for 5 min each.
Mount the slides with mounting medium containing 4',6-Diamidino-2-Phenylindole (DAPI).
Observe the cells utilizing a confocal microscope.
